title: UiPath Automation Suite on Kubernetes Troubleshooting
summary: Troubleshooting UiPath Automation Suite components running on managed Kubernetes (EKS/AKS)

components.orchestrator: Main UiPath Orchestrator managing robots and processes
components.identity-server: Authentication and SSO handling via Identity Server
components.action-center: Manages exceptions, errors, decisions requiring human intervention
components.data-service: Persistent no-code data storage for automations
components.document-understanding: Pre-trained models for document extraction and categorization
components.insights: Analytics platform for operational insights and robot performance
components.integration-service: API connections and SaaS platform integrations

diagnostic_tools.uipathctl: Primary CLI tool for installation, upgrade, and troubleshooting
diagnostic_tools.health_check: uipathctl health check - runs cluster health validation

common_causes.description: Cannot connect to SQL Server or PostgreSQL
common_causes.diagnosis: Check orchestrator logs for SQL connection errors
common_causes.fix: Verify connection string secret, network access, credentials

common_causes.diagnosis: Check identity-service pods, verify OIDC config
common_causes.fix: Restart identity pods, check certificate validity
Renew certificates, verify issuer is working

common_causes.diagnosis: Check orchestrator logs for license errors
common_causes.fix: Update license, verify license server connectivity

common_causes.diagnosis: kubectl top pods, check resource limits
common_causes.fix: Increase resource limits for affected components

common_causes.description: PVC not bound or storage full
common_causes.diagnosis: kubectl get pvc, check storage usage
common_causes.fix: Expand PVC or clean up old data

fix_steps: 1. Check all pods in UiPath namespace are running
3. Check certificates are valid and not expired
4. Review ingress configuration for external access
6. Review application logs for specific errors
